cyclone.name: COLIN
cyclone.current_location: about 550 miles SW of Tampa, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Accelerating north-northeast through the eastern Gulf toward the Florida Big Bend, then moving across north-central Florida and southeast Georgia before emerging offshore and tracking northeast just off the South and North Carolina coasts toward the open western Atlantic.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend coast (Indian Pass–Cedar Key area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Warning currently limited to Indian Pass FL to Englewood FL (Gulf coast)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Indian Pass FL to Englewood FL (Gulf coast)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Gulf coast of Florida, then the Atlantic coasts of northeast Florida, Georgia, South Carolina, and North Carolina
weather_observation.wind: 15-20% chance of tropical-storm-force winds (peak 34-kt probability 20%) late Tue into Wed with gusts 35-45 mph possible.
weather_observation.storm_surge: No significant surge expected along the Cape Fear coast because the center is forecast to remain just offshore.
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rain bands may drop 1-3 inches of rain as the system passes Tuesday night–Wednesday.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous rip currents and minor coastal flooding at high tide possible; isolated brief tornadoes in outer rain bands cannot be ruled out.
